1.speaker: PENGUIN
1.character: なんで　うまく いかないんだろう…
1.definition: I wonder why it's not going well.

2.speaker: PANDA
2.definition: Huh? What? Oh, that. Parallel parking?

4.speaker: PANDA
4.character: じゃあ　できるようになったの？
4.definition: So you're able to do it now?

5.speaker: PENGUIN
5.character: まだ　ちゃんと　できてないけど… 違うってば！
5.definition: No, not quite yet... But that's not it!

6.speaker: PENGUIN
6.character: 僕が言いたいのは　デートだよ デートのお誘いだよ
6.definition: I'm talking about my date. I don't know how to ask someone out.

7.speaker: PANDA
7.character: 会って言えば いいんじゃないの？
7.definition: Why don't you just meet up with her and ask?

8.speaker: PENGUIN
8.character: それができないから 困ってるんだよ
8.definition: That's the problem!I can't bring myself to do it.

10.speaker: PENGUIN
10.character: もう　いい… パンダくんに 相談するんじゃなかった
10.definition: Never mind. It was a mistake to ask you, Panda.

11.speaker: LADY
11.definition: Mr. Polar Bear! Sorry! We're a little late!

15.speaker: SASAKO
15.character: 昨日　言ったじゃないですか

17.speaker: MAYUMI
17.character: 『月刊　フラフラウォーカー』のライター 大崎と申します
17.definition: Hi, I'm a writer for "Furafura Walker Monthly." My name is Ohsaki.

20.speaker: MAYUMI
20.character: あの…　編集長が 先に来ているはずなんですが
20.definition: Um, well, our editor-in-chief should be here already. Editor-in-chief? I don't believe he's here yet.

21.speaker: MAYUMI
21.character: そうですか… どうしたんだろう？
21.definition: I see. I wonder what happened.

22.speaker: MAYUMI
22.character: 実は こちらの　しろくまカフエを絶対　取り上げよう って言ったのは
22.definition: Actually, the person who wanted to cover this place was our editor-in-chief. He's got a knack for finding

23.character: オープンカフェを見つける勘がとても鋭くて
23.definition: hole-in-the-wall cafés and unique open cafés.

24.speaker: MAYUMI
24.character: うちの雑誌は　編集長のセンスに 支えられているようなものです
24.definition: Our magazine pretty much runs on his intuition.

25.speaker: PENGUIN
25.definition: Did you hear? It's a piece for a magazine. Piece?

26.speaker: PENGUIN
26.character: いろいろ　インタビューしたり 写真撮ったりするんじゃない？
26.definition: They're probably going to do a few interviews and take a lot of pictures.

27.speaker: PANDA
27.character: インタビュー？ 写真？

28.speaker: PANDA
28.character: ファンレターとか届いたりして
28.definition: I wonder if I'll get fan mail.

29.speaker: PENGUIN
29.character: パンダくんの取材じゃないよ
29.definition: The piece isn't about you, Panda. If they interview customers, our pictures will be in the magazine. That's not okay!

30.speaker: PENGUIN
30.character: 僕写真写り自信ないんだよ　ああ…

31.speaker: MAYUMI
31.character: じゃあ　とりあえず 取材を 始めさせていただきますね
31.definition: Well then, let's begin our interview.

32.speaker: MAYUMI
32.character: まずはシロクマさんに
32.definition: First, we'd like to know how it all began. How it all began {\i1}(ikisatsu){\i0}...

33.speaker: PENGUIN
33.definition: That would be an artistic masterpiece {\i1}(rikisaku){\i0}.

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.definition: That would be a police officer{\i1} (keisatsu){\i0}.

37.speaker: MAYUMI
37.character: あ…　えっと…　そのダジャレは…
37.definition: U-Um... those puns... That would be a greeting{\i1} (aisatsu){\i0}!

38.speaker: MAYUMI
38.character: かぶせてきましたね編集長
38.definition: Way to step right in, Mr. Editor!

39.speaker: MAYUMI
39.character: マスターはダジャレが得意なナイスガイ…　と
39.definition: The owner is a pun-loving, nice guy.

41.speaker: MAYUMI
41.character: はい　うちの編集長 ハシビロコウさんです
41.definition: Yes, he's our editor-in-chief, Mr. Shoebill. Right? Your lead was amazing this time!

42.speaker: MAYUMI
42.character: 編集長が　本当に ここは　すばらしいカフェだと
42.definition: He says that this café is absolutely amazing.

44.speaker: MAYUMI
44.character: それでは　改めまして
44.definition: So, once again, why did you decide to open this café? I guess she's going to ask him after all.

46.speaker: POLAR BEAR
46.character: 話せば長くなるんだけど

47.character: 僕はカナダのハドソン湾で生まれたの
47.definition: but I was born near the Hudson Bay in Canada. I was the youngest of triplets, and the smallest.

48.speaker: POLAR BEAR
48.character: お母さんが食べ物を探して歩くと
48.definition: Whenever my mom would go look for food,

49.speaker: POLAR BEAR
49.character: いつも僕だけ遅れてしまった

50.speaker: POLAR BEAR
50.character: そして　ある吹雪の日
50.definition: Then, one day, during a snowstorm, I was completely separated from my family.

52.speaker: POLAR BEAR
52.character: お母さんたちの姿はどこにもなかった
52.definition: I couldn't see my mom or siblings anywhere.

53.speaker: POLAR BEAR
53.character: 一生懸命呼んだけど 応えはない
53.definition: I called out for them, but there was no answer.

54.speaker: POLAR BEAR
54.definition: And then, I noticed... the piece of ice I was on was floating away.

55.speaker: POLAR BEAR
55.character: 僕はひとりぼっちで海の上を漂流していった
55.definition: I was all alone and drifting out to sea.

57.speaker: PANDA
57.character: そ…　それで どうなったの？
57.definition: W-What happened after that? When I'd gotten so hungry that I couldn't even move,

58.speaker: POLAR BEAR
58.character: 僕は通りがかった猟師の人に助けられたんだ
58.definition: I was rescued by a passing fisherman.

59.speaker: POLAR BEAR
59.character: それから　僕は助けてくれた人の両親に預けられた
59.definition: After that, he left me in his parents' care.

60.speaker: POLAR BEAR
60.character: そこは小さな食堂をやっていて

61.speaker: POLAR BEAR
61.definition: and as I helped them out,

62.speaker: POLAR BEAR
62.character: 僕は料理が好きになった

63.speaker: POLAR BEAR
63.character: でも　そんな生活も長くは続かなかったよ
63.definition: But that life didn't last long, either.

64.speaker: POLAR BEAR
64.character: 僕は　大きくなりすぎて
64.definition: I became so big that I couldn't stay at their house anymore.

67.speaker: POLAR BEAR
67.character: お店をやっていたら いつか話が伝わって
67.definition: I thought if I started a café, word would eventually get around,

68.speaker: POLAR BEAR
68.character: お母さんたちに会えるかもしれないから
68.definition: and I might be able to see my family again. Huh? What?

69.speaker: MAYUMI
69.character: わかります 編集長

70.speaker: MAYUMI
70.character: シロクマさんの大変さを思うと…
70.definition: Just thinking about Mr. Polar Bear's suffering...

73.speaker: PANDA
73.character: お母さんたちには まだ会えないの？
73.definition: Have you seen your family yet?

75.speaker: SASAKO
75.character: あれ？　私この前は建設会社を脱サラして
75.definition: Huh? I thought you told me the other day that you quit your job at the construction company to open up the café. There's that version, too.

78.speaker: MAYUMI
78.character: ははぁ　真相は お好みってことですね
78.definition: Oh, so we can use whichever version we like.

79.speaker: MAYUMI
79.definition: Nothing less from the nice guy.

80.speaker: MAYUMI
80.character: じゃあ　次の質問ですが…

81.speaker: MAYUMI
81.character: どうしました！？　編集長！
81.definition: What's wrong, Mr. Editor? Oh, those flowers. Who did these fabulous arrangements?

82.speaker: SASAKO
82.character: 近くの花屋さんに お願いしてるんです
82.definition: A local flower shop does it for us.

88.speaker: SASAKO
88.definition: It's our very own vegetable garden. We grow the vegetables and herbs that we use in the café.

89.speaker: MAYUMI
89.character: さすが編集長！ どんなことも見逃しませんね
89.definition: You're amazing, Mr. Editor! You don't miss a thing.

93.speaker: MAYUMI
93.character: そんなステキなしろくまカフェさんなんですが
93.definition: You have such an amazing place.

94.speaker: MAYUMI
94.character: オススメがあれば ぜひ紹介していただけますか？
94.definition: Would you be willing to share any recommendations you have?

95.speaker: PANDA
95.character: 笹大盛りがオススメだよ！
95.definition: I recommend the large serving of bamboo grass!

96.speaker: PENGUIN
96.character: それ　料理じゃなくて素材だよね
96.definition: That's more like raw ingredients than food.

97.speaker: PANDA
97.character: あぁ　家の隣にあってすぐ来られるのもオススメ
97.definition: Oh! I also recommend how it's right next to my house and easy to get to.

98.speaker: PENGUIN
98.character: パンダくんだけでしょ

99.speaker: MAYUMI
99.character: 素材と立地が抜群　と…
99.definition: The ingredients and location are extraordinary.

100.speaker: MAYUMI
100.definition: What else? The lunch pasta is popular. The one with anchovies.

101.speaker: PANDA
101.character: 春野菜も　いいよね
101.definition: The one with spring vegetables, too.

102.speaker: SASAKO
102.character: せっかくだから 食べてもらったら　どうでしょう？
102.definition: Why don't we make it for them since they're here?

103.speaker: MAYUMI
103.character: どうですか？　編集長
103.definition: What do you think, Mr. Editor?

104.speaker: PANDA
104.character: パスタ　嫌いなのかな？

105.speaker: POLAR BEAR
105.character: 意外とダイナミックだよね

106.speaker: MAYUMI
106.character: そうですか！ とっても　おいしいそうです
106.definition: I see! He says it's very delicious!

108.speaker: PENGUIN
108.character: えっ！？ この間の雑誌もう出たの？

109.speaker: POLAR BEAR
109.character: うん　サンプルが来てる
109.definition: Yup. I received a sample copy. Let me see, let me see!

112.speaker: PENGUIN
112.definition: I'm in it. It appears so. Polar Bear's Café Polar Bear's Café

114.speaker: POLAR BEAR
114.character: おはよう　パンダくん

115.speaker: PANDA
115.character: あれ！？　これ　なんの荷物？

116.speaker: POLAR BEAR
116.definition: I'm getting ready for a trip.

117.speaker: PANDA
117.character: えっ！？　出かけちゃうの？ カフェは？
117.definition: You're going on a trip? What about the café?

118.speaker: POLAR BEAR
118.definition: It's closed for the day. What?

119.speaker: PANDA
119.character: せっかく　早起きできたからモーニング食べようと思ったのに
119.definition: But I got up early, so I figured I could make it in time for breakfast.

123.speaker: GRIZZLY
123.character: シロクマ！ 用意はできてんだろうな？
123.definition: You better be ready, Polar Bear.

126.speaker: PANDA
126.character: グリズリーさんおはよう

128.speaker: PANDA
128.character: シロクマくんとどこ行くの？
128.definition: Where are you two headed? We're gonna go get some ingredients.

129.speaker: POLAR BEAR
129.character: 料理の材料を発掘しに
129.definition: We're going to go excavate for some ingredients for cooking.

131.speaker: PANDA
131.definition: I wanna go, too. This ain't no game!

132.speaker: POLAR BEAR
132.character: まぁ　でも 遠足みたいなものかな
132.definition: Well, it is sort of like a field trip.

134.speaker: PANDA
134.character: 笹はおやつに入る？ ごはんかな？
134.definition: Will there be bamboo grass for snacks? Or maybe lunch?

136.speaker: POLAR BEAR
136.character: アザラシはごはんだけど…

138.speaker: POLAR BEAR
138.definition: Maybe walruses. What the hell are you babbling about?

139.definition: Let's go! Hurry and get in!

141.speaker: POLAR BEAR
141.character: 何？　グリズリーくん

142.speaker: GRIZZLY
142.character: なんでアイツがいるんだよ？
142.definition: Why the hell is he here? You told him to get in.

143.speaker: GRIZZLY
143.definition: That's not what I meant! It doesn't really matter.

145.character: 山？　それとも　海？
145.definition: To the mountains? Or maybe to the beach?

146.speaker: PANDA
146.character: 山はおいしい笹がいっぱい生えてるし…
146.definition: There's lots of delicious bamboo grass in the mountains.

147.speaker: PANDA
147.character: 海はかわいい女の子がいっぱいいるよね
147.definition: And there're a lot of cute girls at the beach.

149.speaker: GRIZZLY
149.character: お前は店で出す分が欲しいんだろ？
149.definition: You want some for your café, right?

150.speaker: POLAR BEAR
150.character: うん　いっぱい獲れるといいな
150.definition: Yup. It'd be great if we catch get a lot.

151.speaker: GRIZZLY
151.character: 結構いそうな感じだぜ
151.definition: It looks like there's quite a few.

153.speaker: GRIZZLY
153.character: あれが俺たちの獲物だ
153.definition: That would be our target. That?

155.speaker: GRIZZLY
155.definition: What? I was imagining something more like bamboo shoots.

156.speaker: GRIZZLY
156.definition: If you don't want any, go home!

157.speaker: PANDA
157.character: なんだ…　発掘じゃないじゃない
157.definition: This isn't an excavation at all.

158.speaker: POLAR BEAR
158.character: 似たようなもんでしょ

161.speaker: POLAR BEAR
161.character: 明日からのしろくまカフェのランチ
161.definition: Starting tomorrow, lunch at Polar Bear's Café

162.speaker: POLAR BEAR
162.character: グリズリー君にかかってるんだから
162.definition: is all riding on you, Grizzly.

163.speaker: GRIZZLY
163.character: まったく…　他力本願なヤツめ
163.definition: Jeez, relying on me to do all your work.

164.speaker: PANDA
164.character: えっ　どうやって獲るの？
164.definition: Ooh, how's he going to catch it?

167.speaker: GRIZZLY
167.character: まぁ　俺の手にかかりゃ こんなもんよ

169.speaker: PANDA
169.character: わぁ…　ピチピチしてる
169.definition: They're wiggling around. I faced a situation like this as a kid, too...

171.speaker: GRIZZLY
171.definition: I can't catch any of them.

172.speaker: GRIZZLY
172.character: なんだシロクマ！　テメエ！ 笑って見てんじゃねえ！
172.definition: What the hell's your problem, Polar Bear?! Don't stand there laughing!

174.speaker: GRIZZLY
174.character: 笑ってるだろうが　口がよ！

175.speaker: POLAR BEAR
175.character: 口の下が黒いだけだよ
175.definition: It's just that my bottom lip is black.

176.speaker: GRIZZLY
176.character: ホントだ　口　閉じてる
176.definition: You're right, your mouth is closed.

178.speaker: GRIZZLY
178.character: やっぱ　笑ってんじゃねえか！
178.definition: You are laughing, you ass! Couldn't help it.

179.speaker: GRIZZLY
179.character: アイツに笑われてた俺も
179.definition: He may have been laughing then,

180.character: 今じゃ　立派にサケが獲れるようになったんだぜ
180.definition: but I can catch salmon like no other now. What the hell are you doing? {eh?} Getting ready for a picnic.

181.speaker: GRIZZLY
181.character: 俺が働いてるときに何だそりゃ！
181.definition: What the hell are you doing while I'm doing all the work?!

182.speaker: POLAR BEAR
182.character: まぁまぁ　グリズリーくんがサケ獲って お腹が空いたら
182.definition: Now, now, when you get hungry from catching all the salmon,

183.speaker: POLAR BEAR
183.character: ランチができてるってわけ
183.definition: I'll have lunch ready for you.

184.speaker: POLAR BEAR
184.character: なかなか　いいでしょ

185.speaker: GRIZZLY
185.character: 腹にたまるもんを頼むぜ
185.definition: Make something that'll fill me up. There aren't any salmon. What the hell are you doing?!

186.speaker: PANDA
186.character: なかなか グリズリーさんみたいにはいかないね
186.definition: I can't seem to get the hang of it like you, Mr. Grizzly. It totally looked like anyone could do it.

187.speaker: GRIZZLY
187.character: いいか　よく見てろ
187.definition: Jeez, watch closely. This is how it's—

188.speaker: PANDA
188.character: もういいや　笹食べよっと
188.definition: I'm done. I'm gonna go eat bamboo grass.

189.speaker: GRIZZLY
189.character: そんな簡単に諦めんな！
189.definition: Don't wuss out so easily! But I'm tired, and I'm hungry.

190.speaker: GRIZZLY
190.character: そういう問題じゃねえ！

191.speaker: GRIZZLY
191.character: 同じクマとして　シロクマ！お前もコイツに何か言ってやれ！
191.definition: You're a bear, too, Polar Bear! Talk to him!

192.speaker: POLAR BEAR
192.character: パンダくんは 竹と笹があれば満足だから
192.definition: Panda is happy if he has his bamboo and bamboo grass.

195.speaker: GRIZZLY
195.character: クマは狩りだろ 狩ってこそのクマだろ！
195.definition: If you're a bear, hunt! Hunting is what makes you a bear!

197.speaker: POLAR BEAR
197.character: ちょっとそこでとってきた

198.speaker: POLAR BEAR
198.character: これだったら　パンダくんも狩りをする気になるでしょ
198.definition: This will probably make Panda want to hunt, too.

200.speaker: PANDA
200.character: えっ　サケってタケノコ食べるの？

202.speaker: GRIZZLY
202.character: お前が食うんだよ　パンダ
202.definition: You're going to eat it, Panda.

204.speaker: POLAR BEAR
204.character: グリズリーくんが 狩りのお手本見せてくれるって
204.definition: Grizzly's going to show you how to hunt.

205.speaker: POLAR BEAR
205.character: 狩りをしてこそのクマだもんね
205.definition: Hunting is what makes you a bear, right? Y-Yeah! Watch closely, Panda.

206.speaker: POLAR BEAR
206.character: まずは　標的を見つける

207.speaker: POLAR BEAR
207.definition: Don't ever take your eyes off of it.

208.speaker: POLAR BEAR
208.character: 獲物の動きを予測する
208.definition: Predict how your enemy will move.

209.speaker: GRIZZLY
209.character: どうだ　やってみろ
209.definition: How's that? Now you do it.

211.speaker: GRIZZLY
211.character: って食ってんじゃねえ！

212.speaker: GRIZZLY
212.character: ちゃんと泳いでるタケノコをとれ
212.definition: Come catch the swimming bamboo shoot!

213.speaker: POLAR BEAR
213.character: タケノコは泳がないよ

216.speaker: PANDA
216.character: イライラしないで　グリズリーさん
216.definition: Don't be so mad, Mr. Grizzly.

217.speaker: PANDA
217.character: 僕のとっておきの笹あげるから
217.definition: I'll give you my best bamboo grass.

218.speaker: PANDA
218.character: 笹は健康にもいいんだよ
218.definition: It's really good for your health, too.

219.speaker: GRIZZLY
219.character: お前も食わず嫌いしてないで
219.definition: Don't be a picky eater yourself, and eat some salmon. Okay.

221.speaker: GRIZZLY
221.character: あんまし　うまくねえ
221.definition: Not that good. Isn't the salmon better? Not really.

227.speaker: PANDA
227.character: いっぱいとれてよかったね
227.definition: It's good that you caught so much.

229.speaker: GRIZZLY
229.character: おい　パンダ！　こっちだ

231.speaker: SASAKO
231.character: おかげさまで大人気ですよ　ランチパスタ
231.definition: The lunch pasta is a hit, thanks to you.

235.speaker: POLAR BEAR
235.definition: It's for all your hard work yesterday.

236.speaker: GRIZZLY
236.character: おい　パンダ　俺のタケノコお前にやる
236.definition: Hey, Panda, I'll give you my bamboo shoots. I'll give you my salmon, Mr. Grizzly.

237.speaker: SASAKO
237.character: あ　好き嫌いはダメですよ
237.definition: It's not good to be such picky eaters.

238.speaker: GRIZZLY
238.character: 細かいこと気にするなよ

241.speaker: PANDA
241.character: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

242.speaker: PENGUIN
242.definition: What is it, Panda? Please tell me all the life lessons you have learned so far.

243.speaker: PENGUIN
243.character: 飲み会で最後に残った一個を食べる時は
243.definition: When you're out drinking with others, and you're trying to eat the last piece,

244.speaker: PENGUIN
244.character: お皿を下げてもらうどさくさで食べちゃえば
244.definition: if you try to eat it as they're taking the plate,

246.speaker: PANDA
246.character: 心の底から小さい知恵だね
246.definition: That is a truly shallow life lesson.

248.speaker: POLAR BEAR
248.definition: Next time, on Polar Bear's Café Z.
